author: sky.cactus
content: Do Ethereum clients (both execution and consensus) generally work when they are on a non-standard port?  I'm running two testnet nodes on one host, and one of the nodes has non-default ports for EL and CL.  I am noticing that the EL only has 1 peer and I'm wondering if this is because it isn't on the default port?

author: sky.cactus
content: I configured the node to use a different port (30304) and I also made sure it is exposed to the internet on a port with the same number, in case there would be an issue with NAT port translation, but I still get only one peer for the EL.
